intro: Tetratheca virgata var. setigera, commonly known as the slender tetratheca, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with slender, often hairy stems and small, ovate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy environments. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
